p: Collectively, these recent YF outbreaks have increased the level of concern about the disease and its potential to spread to non-endemic areas in Africa and Latin America and countries in Asia where YFV is absent [ 23, 24]. Factors that may favor the spread of the disease and increase the likelihood of large urban outbreaks include more abundant vector populations over a wider geographic area [ 25], increasing urbanization, a highly mobile human population [ 21, 26, 27, 28], an increase in the NHP population [ 29], and NHP displacement due to deforestation in the Amazon Basin and forested areas in equatorial Africa [ 24, 30]. Low population immunity to YFV in neighboring endemic areas due to under vaccination may also be a contributing factor [ 31, 32].
